page.description: Generate a SQL statement to retrieve the identity from the last insert statement (may be specific to the table passed in).
page.original:
SQL::Connection::GenerateLastInsertedIdentityStatement() Syntax SQL_Statement as C = .GenerateLastInsertedIdentityStatement( [ as SQL::TableInfo ] ) ArgumentDescription SQL_StatementA SQL select statement. A SQL::Connection object. A SQL::TableInfo object.
Description The SQL::Connection::GenerateLastInsertedIdentityStatement() method retrieves the last identity value generated for an insert on the currently open connection.
This is current connection specific for most databases. For databases that use sequences to maintain identity (such as Oracle), the sequence may not be correct after the transaction has been completed.
For databases that use sequences to generate identities is a required parameter. It must include an identity column in its definition. That column must specify the sequence name to be used. Limitations See Also SQL::Connection Object
